title: Example image
description: This is an example of displaying images in markdown.
author: @abcd

title: What is a counter?
description: This is a short description about my counter post.
author: @luisa

children.value: It allows you to keep track of a number and increment it by clicking on a button.
Initially we manually inserted this counter component in a vue file.
can insert a vue component in the markdown file.

props.code:
components/
 BlogPostList.vue
 BlogPostMeta.vue
 TheHero.vue
 TheNavBar.vue
 content
     Counter.vue
...

children.value: Then you can insert your Counter directly in the markdown file by adding

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}

sections.name: What is a counter?
sections.content: What is a counter?  It allows you to keep track of a number and increment it by clicking on a button.  Initially we manually inserted this counter component in a vue file.                Current Count: {{ currentCount }}          Add 1   Nuxt-content can insert a vue component in the markdown file.  How to do that?  Create a new components/content/Counter.vue component for a counter.  components/  BlogPostList.vue  BlogPostMeta.vue  TheHero.vue  TheNavBar.vue  content      Counter.vue   Add the content go Counter.vue:   const currentCount = ref(0)  const incrementCount = () => {   currentCount.value++ }                        Current Count: {{ currentCount }}              Add 1         ...  Then you can insert your Counter directly in the markdown file by adding ``, like the following:

plainContent: What is a counter?  It allows you to keep track of a number and increment it by clicking on a button.  Initially we manually inserted this counter component in a vue file.                Current Count: {{ currentCount }}          Add 1   Nuxt-content can insert a vue component in the markdown file.  How to do that?  Create a new components/content/Counter.vue component for a counter.  components/  BlogPostList.vue  BlogPostMeta.vue  TheHero.vue  TheNavBar.vue  content      Counter.vue   Add the content go Counter.vue:   const currentCount = ref(0)  const incrementCount = () => {   currentCount.value++ }                        Current Count: {{ currentCount }}              Add 1         ...  Then you can insert your Counter directly in the markdown file by adding ``, like the following:
